howToSchema.name: How to use {toolName}
howToSchema.step1: Upload your file by dragging and dropping it into the upload area, or click to browse your device. All files are processed locally in your browser.
howToSchema.step2: Configure the settings according to your needs. Adjust quality, format, or other options available for this tool.
howToSchema.step3: Click the process button and wait for the result. Once complete, download the processed file directly to your device.

common.seoPrivacy: All processing happens directly in your browser. Your files never leave your device — no server uploads, no cloud storage, no data retention. The tool works offline once loaded, requires no registration, and is completely free with no usage limits.

adblock.title: Oops! Looks like you're using an ad blocker
adblock.message: We get it — ads can be annoying. But here's the thing: every tool on Tuttilo is 100% free, no accounts, no limits, no tricks. The ads are the only way we keep the lights on and the servers humming.
adblock.explain: Disabling your ad blocker for Tuttilo takes 2 seconds and costs you nothing — but it means everything to us. Think of it as buying us a virtual coffee, except you don't even have to pay!
adblock.footnote: After disabling, click the button to reload the page.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.description: Learn how Tuttilo protects your privacy. All file processing happens locally in your browser — we never upload, store, or access your files on any server.
privacy.intro: At Tuttilo, your privacy is our top priority. All file processing happens entirely in your browser — your files are never uploaded to our servers.

noDataCollection.title: We Don't Collect Your Files
noDataCollection.content: Tuttilo is a browser-based tool suite. When you process a PDF, image, video, or any other file, the processing happens locally on your device using JavaScript and WebAssembly. No file data is ever sent to our servers or any third party.

analytics.title: Analytics
analytics.content: We may use anonymous analytics (such as page views and tool usage counts) to improve our service. This data contains no personally identifiable information and cannot be linked to any individual user.

cookies.title: Cookies
cookies.content: Tuttilo uses only essential cookies for basic functionality such as language preference and theme selection. We do not use tracking cookies or advertising cookies.

thirdParty.title: Third-Party Services
thirdParty.content: Our website may load resources from content delivery networks (CDNs) for fonts and JavaScript libraries. These services may receive your IP address as part of standard web requests. We do not share any personal data or file content with third parties.

retention.title: Data Retention
retention.content: Since we do not collect or store your files, there is no file data to retain. Any preferences stored in your browser (such as language or theme) remain on your device and can be cleared at any time through your browser settings.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.content: Under GDPR and other privacy regulations, you have the right to access, correct, or delete any personal data. Since Tuttilo does not collect personal data or files, these rights are inherently respected by our architecture.

changes.title: Changes to This Policy
changes.content: We may update this privacy policy from time to time. Any changes will be posted on this page with an updated revision date.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: If you have questions about this privacy policy, please contact us at the address listed on our Contact page.

advertising.title: Advertising
advertising.content: We display non-invasive advertisements on our tool pages through third-party ad networks (such as Ezoic and Google AdSense). These ads help us keep all tools completely free. Ad networks may use cookies and similar technologies to serve relevant ads based on your browsing activity. You can manage your cookie preferences through the cookie consent banner. We do not sell your personal data to advertisers. Ad revenue is our primary way to sustain this free service.

terms.title: Terms of Service
terms.description: Read the terms and conditions for using Tuttilo free online tools. Understand your rights, our responsibilities, and the rules that govern service usage.
terms.intro: By using Tuttilo, you agree to these terms. Please read them carefully.

service.title: Service Description
service.content: Tuttilo provides free browser-based tools for processing PDFs, images, videos, audio, and text. All processing occurs locally in your browser. We do not guarantee uninterrupted or error-free operation.

usage.title: Acceptable Use
usage.content: You agree to use Tuttilo only for lawful purposes. You are solely responsible for the content you process. You must not use the service to process illegal, harmful, or rights-infringing content.

ip.title: Intellectual Property
ip.content: The Tuttilo name, logo, and website design are our property. The tools are provided for your personal and commercial use. You retain all rights to the files you process.

liability.title: Limitation of Liability
liability.content: Tuttilo is provided "as is" without warranties of any kind. We are not liable for any damages arising from the use of our tools, including but not limited to data loss, file corruption, or processing errors.

warranty.title: Disclaimer of Warranties
warranty.content: We make no warranties about the accuracy, reliability, or completeness of our tools. Results may vary depending on your browser, device, and file format. Always keep backup copies of your original files.

modifications.title: Modifications
modifications.content: We reserve the right to modify or discontinue any tool or feature at any time without notice. We may also update these terms, with changes becoming effective upon posting.

law.title: Governing Law
law.content: These terms are governed by the laws of the European Union. Any disputes shall be resolved in the competent courts.

contact.title: Contact
contact.content: For questions about these terms, please visit our Contact page.

about.title: About Tuttilo
about.description: Tuttilo provides 216+ free online tools for PDF, images, video, audio, text, and developer utilities. Built by Daniele Lo Re — no registration, no limits, everything runs in your browser.
about.intro: Tuttilo is a free, all-in-one online tool suite built by Daniele Lo Re. Every tool works entirely in your browser — your files never leave your device.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.content: We believe powerful tools should be free and accessible to everyone. Tuttilo was created by Daniele Lo Re, a web developer passionate about privacy and open-source software. The goal is simple: provide professional-grade file processing without subscriptions, registrations, or uploads. Every tool runs client-side using modern web technologies like WebAssembly and the Canvas API.

howItWorks.title: How It Works
howItWorks.content: Unlike traditional online tools that upload your files to remote servers, Tuttilo processes everything directly in your browser using JavaScript and WebAssembly. Your files never leave your device — there are no uploads, no servers involved, and no waiting in queues. This approach is not only faster but also fundamentally more private and secure.

pdf-to-word.title: Convert PDF to Word Online Free
pdf-to-word.description: Convert PDF files to editable Word documents (.docx) for free. No signup required. All processing happens in your browser — your files stay private.
pdf-to-word.content: Converting PDF to Word is one of the most common document tasks. Whether you need to edit a contract, update a report, or extract text from a scanned document, our free PDF to Word converter handles it all. The tool preserves formatting, tables, and images while creating an editable .docx file. Unlike other converters, everything runs in your browser — no file uploads to external servers, ensuring complete privacy.

faq.q1: Will the formatting be preserved when converting PDF to Word?
faq.a1: Yes, our converter preserves text formatting, tables, lists, and images. Complex layouts with multiple columns may require minor adjustments in Word.
faq.q2: Can I convert scanned PDFs to editable Word documents?
faq.a2: Yes, our tool includes OCR (Optical Character Recognition) that can extract text from scanned PDFs and image-based documents, making them fully editable in Word.
faq.q3: Is there a file size limit for PDF to Word conversion?
faq.a3: You can convert PDFs up to 50MB for free. Since processing happens in your browser, larger files may take longer depending on your device's performance.

word-to-pdf.title: Convert Word to PDF Online Free
word-to-pdf.description: Convert Word documents (.doc, .docx) to PDF format for free. Preserve formatting perfectly. No signup, no uploads — everything stays in your browser.
word-to-pdf.content: Need to share a Word document that looks the same on every device? Converting Word to PDF ensures your formatting, fonts, and layout remain intact regardless of the recipient's software. Our free converter transforms .doc and .docx files into professional PDF documents instantly. The conversion preserves headers, footers, page numbers, tables, and embedded images with pixel-perfect accuracy.
word-to-pdf.howToTitle: How to Convert Word to PDF
word-to-pdf.readyTitle: Ready to Convert Word to PDF?
word-to-pdf.readySubtitle: Free, fast, and private. No signup required.
word-to-pdf.step2: The converter preserves all formatting and layout

faq.q1: Will my Word document look the same as PDF?
faq.a1: Yes, the conversion preserves fonts, spacing, tables, images, and page layout. The PDF will look identical to your original Word document on any device.
faq.q2: Can I convert password-protected Word files to PDF?
faq.a2: You'll need to remove the password protection from the Word file first. Once unprotected, you can convert it to PDF normally.
faq.q3: Does converting Word to PDF reduce file size?
faq.a3: PDF files are often smaller than Word documents because PDF uses efficient compression for text and images. Expect a 10-30% reduction in file size.

pdf-to-excel.title: Convert PDF to Excel Online Free
pdf-to-excel.description: Extract tables from PDF files into editable Excel spreadsheets (.xlsx) for free. No signup required. Browser-based processing for complete privacy.
pdf-to-excel.content: Extracting data from PDF tables into Excel is essential for financial analysis, data processing, and reporting. Our PDF to Excel converter intelligently detects tables in your PDF and converts them into properly structured Excel spreadsheets. Each table becomes a clean, editable worksheet with correct cell alignment and data types. Perfect for invoices, financial statements, and data reports.
pdf-to-excel.howToTitle: How to Convert PDF to Excel
pdf-to-excel.readyTitle: Ready to Convert PDF to Excel?
pdf-to-excel.readySubtitle: Free, fast, and private. No signup required.

faq.q1: Can it extract multiple tables from one PDF?
faq.a1: Yes, the converter detects all tables in your PDF and places each one in a separate worksheet within the Excel file, maintaining the original structure.
faq.q2: Will formulas be preserved in the conversion?
faq.a2: PDFs don't contain formulas — only displayed values. The converter extracts the visible numbers and text. You'll need to recreate any formulas in Excel.
faq.q3: How accurate is the table detection?
faq.a3: Our tool uses advanced algorithms to detect table boundaries, merged cells, and column alignment. Accuracy is typically 95%+ for well-formatted PDF tables.

pdf-to-powerpoint.content: Transform PDF presentations back into editable PowerPoint slides with our free converter. Each PDF page becomes a separate slide, preserving the original layout, text positioning, and visual design. Ideal for editing presentations you received as PDF, updating old slide decks, or repurposing content. The converter maintains high visual fidelity while making every element editable in PowerPoint.

faq.a1: PDFs don't contain animation data, so those won't transfer. However, all visual elements including text, images, shapes, and layout are faithfully reproduced on each slide.
faq.q2: Can I edit text after converting PDF to PowerPoint?
faq.a2: Yes, text elements are converted as editable text boxes in PowerPoint. You can modify fonts, colors, sizes, and content freely.
faq.q3: What's the maximum number of slides?
faq.a3: There's no slide limit. The converter handles PDFs of any length, creating one PowerPoint slide per PDF page.
